result.execSummary:
The defendant John R. Mandujano Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 2 days if revoked.
Concurrent to 21-CF-623

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program, or obtain GED or HSED during term of probation. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
Perform 60 hours of community service work for a public agency or nonprofit charitable organization. May not have contact with victims. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Not received by Criminal Clerk - RB

1:47 PM Defendant John R. Mandujano Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney David Patton in court for John R. Mandujano Jr.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star in court for State of Wisconsin.  Clerk HM.  State is compliant with victim rights notification. Ct 1 - Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 2 years with conditions concurrent to 21CF623; 2 days credit if revoked; Ct 3 - Court imposes 29 days incarceration with credit for 29 days time served consecutive to ct 5;  Ct 5 - Court imposes 250 days incarceration with credit for 250 days time served consecutive to ct 3; costs ordered and to be paid during time on probation;  DE not eligible for CIP or SAP; DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court. Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Minutes:  21CF623/22CF85.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty David Patton.  VRC.  Cases are resolved.  State will not make a specific recommendation; will not recommend prison

21CF623 - amended misd. information filed.  Deft pleads no contest to both counts; found guilty by the Court.

22CF85 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1, 3, & 5; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts dismissed/read-in on State's motion. 

PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 10/25/22 @ 1:30pm.

Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Patton.   Clerk HMcBride.  PLQ filed.  State is not compliant with victim rights.  CT removed from calendar. PLEAH set over to 9/6 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Patton.  Clerk HMcBride.   State requests adjmt - has not received medical records yet. No objection. Granted.  Speedy trial demand filed today. Atty Patton moves to dismiss - denied by court.  FPT 9/1 1:30pm.   CT rescheduled to 9/6 9am.  Bond continued.  Any pretrial motions shall be filed asap.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Patton.   Clerk HMcBride.  DE requests CT.   FPT 6/30 1130am. CT 7/6 9am - 2 days.   Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Patton.   Clerk HMcBride. Atty Patton requests adjmt to determine whether or not case going to trial. Adjmt granted.  FPT 3/17 10am. Bond continued.

Defendant John R. Mandujano appeared with Attorney Fadil K Idrizi for Attorney David Patton.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Lisa C.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's Lisa C's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

01:18 PM   Attorney Jazmin Ramirez Bailon appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 08:15 am. $2000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). mi
